result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Justice Point: Rock County Supervision  Report

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:57 PM Defendant Steffon Serrel Carter in court in custody at the Rock County Jail by video with attorney Jason D Sanders by video. Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Attorney Johnson moves to strike and dismiss counts 14 and 15. Court orders counts 14 and 15 dismissed. Cash bond set of $1,000.00 with conditions: No possession of weapons. No contact with Co Defendants Luther Hughes or Patrick Butler.  Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 3 PM.
